Item.sqlserver_body:
CREATE FUNCTION [Business_datediff](@STARTDATE DATETIME, @ENDDATE DATETIME, @TZ_NAME NVARCHAR(50) = NULL) RETURNS @RESULT TABLE( value INT) AS BEGIN IF @STARTDATE IS NULL OR @ENDDATE IS NULL BEGIN INSERT @RESULT SELECT NULL
RETURN END
DECLARE @START_DAY_NUMBER INT DECLARE @END_DAY_NUMBER INT
SET @START_DAY_NUMBER = Abs((SELECT VALUE FROM [innovator].[Business_day_number](@STARTDATE, @TZ_NAME)))
IF NOT @START_DAY_NUMBER IS NULL BEGIN SET @END_DAY_NUMBER = Abs((SELECT VALUE FROM [innovator].[Business_day_number](@ENDDATE, @TZ_NAME)))
IF NOT @END_DAY_NUMBER IS NULL BEGIN INSERT INTO @RESULT SELECT @END_DAY_NUMBER - @START_DAY_NUMBER
RETURN END END
-- Otherwise, fall through to Peano subtraction. DECLARE @INC INT DECLARE @ACC INT DECLARE @PTR DATETIME DECLARE @ENDPTR DATETIME
IF @STARTDATE > @ENDDATE SET @INC = -1 ELSE SET @INC = 1
SET @PTR = @STARTDATE -- make sure the endptr is a business day by subtracting one and -- then adding one, otherwise the loop might not terminate SET @ENDPTR = (SELECT value FROM [innovator].[Business_dateadd](@ENDDATE, -1, @TZ_NAME)) SET @ENDPTR = (SELECT value FROM [innovator].[Business_dateadd](@ENDPTR, 1, @TZ_NAME)) SET @ACC = 0
WHILE Datepart(YEAR, @PTR) <> Datepart(YEAR, @ENDPTR) OR Datepart(dayofyear, @PTR) <> Datepart(dayofyear, @ENDPTR) BEGIN SET @PTR = (SELECT value FROM [innovator].[Business_dateadd](@PTR, @INC, @TZ_NAME)) SET @ACC = @ACC + @INC END
INSERT INTO @RESULT SELECT @ACC
RETURN END
Item.name: Business_DateDiff
